message.content:
You can use the following regex expression to extract a three character code from filenames in the specified format:

```python
\b(?:[A-Za-z0-9]{3}\.)?(?:[A-Za-z0-9]+\.)+usfm$
```

Here's a breakdown of this regex expression:

1. `\b` - Matches a word boundary to ensure we are not matching something in the middle of a word.
2. `(?:[A-Za-z0-9]{3}\.)?` - Optionally matches three characters that can be either upper or lower case letters or digits, followed by a dot (but only if it's not the last character). This ensures we capture exactly three characters for the code and don't include any additional characters before the dot.
3. `(?:[A-Za-z0-9]+\.)+` - Matches one or more characters that can be either upper or lower case letters or digits, followed by a dot. This part is responsible for matching everything before the ".usfm" extension.
4. `usfm` - Matches the exact characters "usfm" as the filename extension.
5. `$` - Ensures the regex expression matches until the end of the line (filename).
